meanings.definition: Smoothed or polished by hammering or pressure.
meanings.sent1: The planished surface of the metal reflected the sunlight beautifully.
meanings.sent2: The planished metal had a shiny appearance after being worked on.
meanings.sent3: The planished metal looked so smooth that it almost seemed like a mirror.
meanings.sent4: Her planished jewelry sparkled like stars in the night sky.
meanings.sent5: The planished metal felt as sleek as ice under his fingertips.

meanings.definition: To give a smooth or glossy finish to metal by hammering or pressure.
meanings.sent1: The blacksmith planished the metal to make it shiny and smooth.
meanings.sent2: She planished the silver bracelet until it gleamed in the light.
meanings.sent3: The artist planished the metal with such skill that it looked like a work of art.
meanings.sent4: The sound of the hammer planishing the metal echoed through the workshop.
meanings.sent5: He planished the metal with precision, creating a flawless finish.
